text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section does the term bouquet garni
intimidating well don't let it because
all it means is a little bouquet of
herbs that you throw into a pot of super
stew and an adds lots of flavor the
simplest kind of bouquet garni is just
tying a bunch of herbs together whatever
your recipe calls for say you're making
a stew and you want to add some thyme
sage a little rosemary gather it
together take some kitchen string wrap
it around a few times so it's nice and
secure and just tie it in a knot then
just throw this in the pot when the stew
is done take it out give it a little
squeeze and that's the end it's left all
of its flavor in the broth the only
problem with this method is that some of
the leaves are gonna fall off so it's a
little bit on the rustic side I have no
problem with that but if your guests are
very refined you might want to use the
cheesecloth cheesecloth is a little bit
near because all of the leaves and the
branches stay inside so you just cut
yourself a square obviously if you're
using more herbs kind of bigger piece if
you're just using a few herbs cut a
small piece and then you just put your
herbs right in the middle maybe a bay
leaf if you need a bay leaf you can put
peppercorns in here some garlic chili
whatever whatever you feel like
seasoning your stew with and then I'm
just gonna tie it up into a little
package if you're worried about this
being a little loose you could take some
string and just wrap it around to secure
it even more or not at the end after
it's done you just want to take this out
of the stew and give it a good squeeze
to get all the juices out of it or the
easiest thing really is just to get
yourself a nice big tea ball this is the
kind of tea ball that's meant for a pot
of tea not a cup of tea then you just
put your herbs inside your garlic
peppercorns whatever you want sage
close it and then you have this nice
little hanging thing you can hang it
right from the pot and we'll just Bob in
the stew it'll do its thing at the end
when it's all done give it a shake take
it right out but whatever you do don't
let the term bouquet garni ever
intimidate you again
